intro: Acanthella, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy environments. They are characterized by their spiny leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. Acanthella species are often used in coastal landscaping due to their hardy nature and ability to stabilize dunes. Their ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
